newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: National Hire lists at 10 cent premium.
newsitem.headline: National Hire lists at 10 cent premium.

text.p: Shares in equipment rental firm National Hire Group Ltd listed on the Australian Stock Exchange on Thursday at 60 cents each, a 10 cent premium to the issue price.
The shares were three cents higher at 63 cents at 12.30 p.m. (0230 GMT).
National Hire, which rents general plant and equipment with nine plants in Sydney and the Illawarra region to the south, raised A$3.5 million from its share issue.
The company has forecast sales of A$13.4 million in 1996/97 (July/June) and A$15 million next year.

The company plans to pay a fully franked 1.5 cent per share dividend in September this year and to distribute at least half of future net profits as fully franked dividends in April and September each year.
